sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Inspectors from the UN nuclear watchdog head to Ukraine's embattled Zaporizhia nuclear power plant amid fears of a potential radiation disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Pakistan declares a serious climate catastrophe as floods sweep away roads, villages and homes, with more than 1,000 people killed since June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And liftoff postponed. NASA delays the launch of the Artemis moon rocket due to a technical issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The eyes of Europe have turned to the Zaporizhia power station.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After weeks of hard negotiations, inspectors from the International Atomic Energy Agency have traveled to Ukraine to verify whether Europe's largest nuclear power plant occupied by Russian troops has emerged unscathed from constant attacks between both sides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The mission is a high-risk one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Without an exaggeration, this mission will be the hardest in the history of IAEA given the active combat activities undertaken by the Russian Federation on the ground and also the very blatant way that Russia is trying to legitimize its presence at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Moscow also says it supports the mission, but calls for more pressure on Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Look, pressure on the Ukrainian side to stop shelling the plant's territory could ease the tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia is interested in the IAEA's mission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It has taken part in its preparation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, fears of another nuclear disaster like Chernobyl have put European leaders on edge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We have a common concern. Firstly, nuclear safety and security shouldn't be compromised in this war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So this mission is important. It must protect this plant and the safety and security shouldn't be compromised in this war. So this mission is important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It must protect this plant and the safety and security of the entire region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Secondly, Ukrainian sovereignty over this nuclear plant must not be disputed. Nuclear energy must not be a war tool.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And it's important to defend Ukrainian sovereignty over this nuclear plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere, Russians and Ukrainians have again blamed each other for last night's shelling of inner hodar the town where the power plant is located Kiev accuses Russia of using the plant as a shield for attacks on its positions Egypt is plunged into darkness as the government rations electricity in an effort to conserve

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: energy for export and boost foreign currency reserves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia's war in Ukraine has had an immediate impact on the country, with Cairo turning to the IMF to help mitigate the economic fallout.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, talks are dragging and the faults in the power rationing have sparked criticism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There are frequent power cuts. It occurs when people are studying, working, and it lasts for a very long time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For instance, the power can go out at 7 p.m. and not come back till next morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Yes, there are power outages caused by cable breakage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So the electricity goes out for like an hour. They say it's due to the heat and overload.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It also lights out in Europe as countries brace for the looming energy crisis. Despite being one of the world's wealthiest countries, Switzerland relies heavily on Russian gas and French nuclear power, both of which are in short supply, to sustain its population during the winter months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, barely a year after closing the Moorburg coal station, Germany is considering reopening the plant in order to secure its energy supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: While it is considered as a temporary solution, logistics, infrastructure and the lack of manpower are proving to be significant obstacles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Pakistan, the threat of more people dying in flooding remains high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Since the start of the monsoon season in mid-June, more than 1,000 people have been killed by the violent storms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 80,000 hectares of agricultural land have been destroyed and millions of people have been left homeless, without food or drinking water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Such is the case of a couple in Balochistan in the south of the country, one of the worst affected areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Their house has been submerged by the waters and they've got nothing left.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's all very sad. All my belongings are submerged, my home inundated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Many parts of my home are damaged. I'm worried.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: My children are hungry and sick.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I'm in pain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: What should I do?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I regret now why this house was built.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Now I think how to feed the children or build a house.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Now there's no one that earns a wage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Almost 33 million people have been affected by the torrential rains, or one in seven Pakistanis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The government has deployed the army in some provinces to help people trapped by the torrents, and a state of emergency has been declared by the prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sherbash Sharif said the central government is granting 10 billion rupees, or just over 45 million euros, for Balochistan province, adding that the National Disaster Management Authority, along with provisional government, will plan relief works.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Southern Pakistan is bracing for another deluge over the next few days that could see the death toll climb higher.

sentences.sentence: It's an innocuous marker of the almost nightly raids carried out by Israeli security forces here.

sentences.sentence: At least 85 Palestinians have been killed so far this year, making it the deadliest period in the occupied territory in six years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But Israel says the majority of these people were violent and that every precaution is taken to protect civilians.

sentences.sentence: Israel says it's investigating. He had no connection to any political or militant factions. His goal in life was to secure the future of his son and daughters, especially since he had two daughters who study at university.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Israel has occupied the West Bank for 55 years now, yet peace between the two sides looks further apart than ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of supporters of the influential Shiite cleric Muqtada al-Sadr have stormed Iraq's government palace following his announcement that he will resign from politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Scaling the concrete walls surrounding the building, they broke into the Republican palace, the seat of the current caretaker prime minister, and chanted slogans in support of the cleric. Last month, thousands of al-Sadr's followers occupied parliament in an attempt to prevent rival factions from forming a government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This announcement comes as Baghdad plunges deeper into a political crisis fueled by the 2021 legislative elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is not the first time the cleric has announced his retirement from politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, many fear his statement could lead to further escalation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Iraq's military has implemented a curfew, calling on the protesters to pull back from the green zone and exercise self-restraint in order to prevent clashes or the spilling of Iraqi blood. up. Three, two, one, but no lift off for NASA's mega rocket Artemis, which was to orbit the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: moon in a test flight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Fuel leaks have forced NASA to abandon the six-week mission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The aircraft was not going to fly with a human crew, but instead test tummies, fitted with sensors to measure vibration, cosmic radiation and other conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The next attempt could take place on Friday at the earliest. This mission will kick off NASA's 21st Century Moon Exploration Programme, named Artemis after Apollo's mythical twin sister. Assuming the test goes well, astronauts will climb aboard for the second flight and progress around the Moon and back as soon as 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A two-person lunar landing could then follow by the end of 2025.
